title: As a BOC User, I want to see a "Reason" column added to the Taxi Squad Utility
custom_steps:
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Taxi+Squad

Wires:
View: https://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=taxi_squad
Edit: https://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=edit_-_taxi_squad

AC:
 - There will be a new "Reason" column added to the Taxi Squad widget.
 - The "Reason" column will appear after the "Time" column
 - The column will be a dropdown and the values will be:
-- Blank  
-- Acclimation Day / Workout
-- To Potentially Replace An Injured Player
 - The column will be Required.

 - There will be a new "Injured Player" column added to the Taxi Squad widget.
 - The "Injured Player" column appear after the "Reason" column
 - If "To Potentially Replace An Injured Player" is selected as the answer for the Reason column, "Injured Player" column becomes required.
 - If "Acclimation Day / Workout" is selected as the answer for the Reason column, "Injured Player" column is not required.
 - The column will be a select2 populated with all the players in the selected Org.

title: As a BOC AMT User, I want Travel Forms to open in Edit Mode when I open them from the Travel Forms Widget
custom_steps:
Business Value:  Currently, if a BOC user wants to add comments while rejecting or approving a travel form, they have to edit the form prior to rejection.

AC:
 - When viewing the Travel Forms Authorization widget, BOC Users will see a Status column that is a hyperlink
 - Clicking on the status of a Form will open that form in edit mode

title: As an AMT User, I want to see a Days in Trip field added to the Travel Form
custom_steps:
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Travel+Authorization+Form

Wireframes:
Edit: https://zpl.io/adPMAEK
View: https://zpl.io/V1wdB8B

AC:
 - There will be a new "Days in Trip" field added to the Trip Info section of Travel Forms
 - The field will appear after the Travel Dates
 - The field will just be a text box, with no calculations behind it

title: As an AMT Club User, I want to be reminded when my expenses are due
custom_steps:
The system should calculate when the Travel Expenses are due (30 days after the trip) and display this information in the Travel Expenses section.

Wire:
https://zpl.io/V1wdB8B

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Travel+Authorization+Form

AC:
 - There will be a new "Expenses Due" field added to the top of the Travel Expenses section of the Travel Authorization Form
 - The field will show the date the expenses are due to be paid
  -- Calculated as 30 days after the initial date of travel (Arrival Date)
 - The field will not be editable

title: As a AMT Club User, I want to receive an email 5 days prior to travel expense becoming due
custom_steps:
AC:
  - Five days prior to the calculated Expenses Due date on an Approved Travel Authorization Form, the system will send an email to users of the Club that submitted the Form
 - Text of email:
**Subject:** Travel Expenses Due Soon
**Content:** Expenses for the travel of  [Last, First] are due on [Expenses Due Date].  Please log into AMT to review.

title: As an AMT Club User, I want to edit and resubmit an Approved Travel Form
custom_steps:
Clubs can edit, but they'd need to submit again, and would be required to enter comments on why its being submitted (new resubmission comments)

Wireframe: 
Modal: https://zpl.io/blL7Lge
Post resubmission form: https://zpl.io/V1wdB8B

AC:
 - Club AMT Users will be see an Edit to Resubmit button on Approved Travel Auth Forms
 - Clicking Edit to Resubmit if prompt the User to confirm their choice:
  -- **Title:**  Are you sure?
  -- **Body:**  The Travel Form will move back to Preliminary and will need to be submitted again to BOC for Approval
  -- **Hint:**  Do you wish to continue?
  -- **Buttons:** Continue, Cancel
 - Clicking Yes will load the form in edit mode and revert it back to Preliminary state
 - Clicking No will dismiss the modal
 - The modal will also have a required "Re-submission Comments" comment cox
  -- Comments entered here will appear in the Status & Dates section of the form, as depicted in the wire

Related to #161812845:
 - When a Club User is viewing an Approved Travel Auth Form, the Edit button will be renamed to "Edit Expenses"

title: As an AMT User, I want to see Check In Location Comments on the Check In History widget
custom_steps:
Business Value:
 - When Country and Location Comments are required during check in, there is currently no place to see them in the system.  Users have requested they be made available on prospect profiles.

Wire:
https://zpl.io/VkEXRXg

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Prospect+Profile

AC:
 - There will be two new columns added to the end of the Check In History widget on prospect profiles:
  -- Country
  -- Location Comments
 - Country will be located after the Days column
 - Location Comments will be located after the Country column
 - Country will display the country selected when "Other Country Off-site" is chosen as the Check In Location
 - Location Comments will be a comment bubble that displays the comments entered when one of the following Check In locations is chosed:
  -- DR Off-site
  -- VZ Off-site
  -- Other Country Off-site

title: As a Club AMT User, I want to skip taking a picture during Check In if prospect isn't present
custom_steps:
Wireframe: https://zpl.io/V0JDDwl

AC:
 - On the photo tab during prospect check-in, there will be a "Player Not Present" checkbox
 - If this checkbox is selected, the user will be allowed to move to the next screen(enable the next button) and complete check in without taking a picture
 - When this checkbox is checked during check in, Club users will have the ability to upload a picture via the Check In History widget on the prospect's profile
 - Club users will only have 24-hours to upload this photo
 - After the 24-hour period has elapsed, they will no longer have the option to upload a photo

title: As a AMT User, I want prospects to automatically be checked out if they have an MNC reach Terms Submitted state in ebis
custom_steps:
Business Value:  Prospectss are required to be checked in while they are at Academies.  If the prospect signs a contract, the Club will often not check the player out of the Academy.  This leads to a high number of overdue prospects.

AC:
 - If a checked in prospect has a MNC reach Terms Submitted state in ebis, that prospect should automatically checked out in AMT
 - A query should be run to identify checked in prospects who have an MNC in Terms Submitted state or greater
  -- A data fix should be run to check all of these players out

title: As an AMT User, I want to see a Help Page in the application
custom_steps:
AC:
 - All Users will see a 'Help' link in the Top Nav
 - The link will be to the right of Travel Forms
 - Clicking the link will load the Help Dashboard
 - The Help Dashboard will host the documents attached to this story
 - BOC Users will have the ability to add / remove documents (future story)

title: As a BOC AMT User, I want Remove Documents from the AMT Help Page
custom_steps:
AC:
 - When BOC Users view the AMT Help Page, there will be a trash can icon next to each file
 - Clicking the trash can will prompt the user to confirm they wish to remove the file
  -- If they confirm the decision, the row  will be cleared from the widget
  -- If they do not confirm the decision, the user will be returned to the widget and no action will be taken.

title: As a BOC AMT User, I want to Add Documents to the AMT Help Page
custom_steps:
AC:
 - When BOC Users are viewing the AMT Help page, there will be an Add Row button
 - Clicking the Add Row button will add a row to the help page
 - The new row will have an a file browser for the user to select the file they wish to upload (i.e. Blank Forms in ebis)
 - After Add Row is clicked, it will be replaced by a Save button and a Cancel button
 - Clicking Save will commit the changes and take the row out of edit mode
 - Clicking Cancel will remove the row and not commit any changes

title: As a BOC User, I want to be notified if a club changes their designated Employee Negotiator in the Signatory widget
custom_steps:
Related to: #166744924

AC:
 - When a club changes their Employee Negotiator in the Signatory widget, BOC Users will receive a Clipboard Notification
  -- [Org] has removed [User] as an Employee Negotiator.
  -- [Org] has added [User] as an Employee Negotiator.

title: As an AMT User, I want to see a link that will open a new email message to amt@mlb.com
custom_steps:
AC:
 - For all Users, there will be a link to email the AMT BOC Admins at the top of AMT
 - It will appear to the left of the English / Spanish toggle
 - When English is selected, it will read:
  -- "For additional questions: AMT@mlb.com"
 - When Spanish is selected, it will read:
  -- "Para preguntas adicionales: AMT@mlb.com"
 - For both, AMT@mlb.com will be a blue hyperlink
 - Clicking the hyperlink will open a new message in your default email client to that address

title: As a developer I want the Nightly Potential MN FA batch to use views to get its initial population rather than inline SQLs
custom_steps: Currently the NightlyPotentialFABatchService is using hardcoded inline SQLs to get its initial population.  That should be updated to pull from a view so changes to the population can be easily tweaked.

title: As a developer I want the Potential MN FA Year batch to use views to get its initial population rather than inline SQLs
custom_steps:
Currently the PotentialMnFAYearBatchService is using hardcoded inline SQLs to get its initial population.  That should be updated to pull from a view so changes to the population can be easily tweaked.

Some (or all) of the updates for this story may be handled by #167908598

title: As a user I want the potential mn fa batches to mark players as pot mn fa NO when their current contract year is voided and they are in the last year of their MNC.
custom_steps:
Currently the nightly potential mn fa batch (and the year batch as well) are treating players who have 1 year remaining on their contract and the current year voided as potential MN FAs when they should instead be marked as a "no".

Note: once an organizations last minor league club has passed its last game and last playoff game date ALL players with one year remaining will flip to 'no' including the players in this population - adjusting those dates (most end around sept 5th) may be necessary for this story

Some example players to look at:
Devin Mesoraco (339319)
Ronald Torreyes (359806)
Michael Marjama (366243)

title: As an AMT user, I want to be sure that AMT works with the new ebis Okta authentication
custom_preconds:
(Depends on https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/166820441)

GIVEN AMT uses the auth procedure for eBIS so that it can do eBIS matching and enter amateur "suspects"  
AND we need to ensure that AMT uses whatever new auth signatures are in place and refresh tokens appropriately.
custom_steps: WHEN the amt app is cut over to use OKTA for authentication
custom_expected: THEN the usual AMT procedures for matching prospects and saving new prospects should still function as expected with BOC and club users

title: Please add Player ID to the PIEF List View
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with permission to access the PIEF List report
custom_steps: WHEN user runs the report
custom_expected: THEN Player ID should be one of the columns and should be populated correctly for each player

title: As a former Employee Negotiator, I want to continue seeing and receiving emails and notifications for requests I am named on
custom_preconds:
(Business Value:
If an Org changes Employee Negotiators while an Employee Request is in flight, the Negotiator that was included on the request when it was created should continue being the designated negotiator.)

GIVEN an Employee Permission Request is in flight (status > Preliminary)
custom_steps: WHEN a user changes the Employee Negotiator for their org
custom_expected:
THEN the original negotiator should continue seeing the request on their Employee Permission Request widget
AND the original negotiator should continue receiving clipboard notifications about the request
AND the original negotiator should continue receiving emails about the request
